title: Ballpark Guide
custom_steps:
Use the following wiki docs for homebase and data lookup: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/QAspace/Using+Homebase+for+Ballpark
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/QAspace/Data+Points+and+Lookups

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the 'Ballpark Guide Page' screen is displayed
and the 'Teams' button is tapped (top left corner)
custom_steps_separated.expected: When user taps on "Teams", slide up Team Picker

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the Ballpark Guide page
and the user sits on the Ballpark Guide screen
and does not tap anything
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app should poll/refresh every 5 minutes for new updates

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to any Ballpark Guide page
and views the contents of the page below the scrolling upcoming event module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
- "Ballpark Name" grid will typically include: Purchase Tickets, Offers & Promotions, Map & Directory, About the Ballpark (This square can be configured to another view like My Accounts, Games, Food Ordering, etc.)
- List Items: Upgrade Seats, Order Food, Beverages, Order Merchandise, Ballpark Experiences, Closed Captioning, Text to Security 
-"Event Highlights" section
-"Videos" section
- "{Club} Insider" section (if applicable)
- "Games" section (configurable)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the Ballpark Guide page
and working in Homebase or edits the ballpark.json file so that config changes are made to Ballpark Guide page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then all changes made will be visible in the app

*To see it right away you need to uninstall then reinstall qa build.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to any Ballpark Guide page
and the user looks along the bottom of the stadium image
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see buttons for Schedule, Check In, Photos under the stadium image

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Ballpark Guide page for a team that has a valid url in the ballpark.json for "upgradeURL"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a button for Upgrade under the stadium image along with the other action buttons

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Ballpark Guide page for a team that has nothing in the ballpark.json for "upgradeURL"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will only see the three action action buttons (Schedule, Check In, Photos)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to the Ballpark Music page
and the content loads
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to scroll up and down the list of player music

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on an item within the Ballpark Guide page and navigates back (tapping Back arrow on subview like Maps or Done/Close on webview/modal)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought back to the 'Ballpark Guide' page

(Confirm this for all items within the page. Subviews slide from right to left will have back button and modals which slide from bottom to top will have done/close button)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to the Music page
and taps on a song in the player music list
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to that song in iTunes for purchase (if available for purchase)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to any 'Ballpark Guide' page
and has tapped on the "Offers & Promotions" button
and the content on the page loads
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then then the user will see all available offers on a webview

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on 'About the Ballpark' on the 2x2 grid on the Ballpark guide
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to a webview
and this webview will team specific

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we set up a Menu Item in QA Homebase for a stadium
add that menu item has the "CheckedIn Only" flag checked
and we have performed a Stadium Check-in to the stadium in which the menu item is configured
and we navigate to that stadium's Ballpark Guide
and tap on the configured menu item
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we should be able to tap on the menu item
and it should launch the Link URL of that menu item

custom_steps_separated.content:
Given we have a set up a Menu Item in QA Homebase for a stadium
And that menu item has the "CheckedIn Only" flag checked
And the user has NOT performed a Stadium Check-in for the game at that stadium
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then that menu item will display "Check-in required" in light gray text below the menu title
And when the user taps on the menu item then the pop up message will say "Check-in required"
And the user will NOT be taken to the Link URL of that menu item

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we have configured sub-menu items under a menu item in QA Homebase for a stadium
and tap on the menu item associated with the sub-menu items added
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the sub menu's will appear below the menu item
and when tapped will go to the Link URL configured

REPEAT FOR ALL SUB-MENU ITEMS CONFIGURED

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we have a set up a Menu Item in QA Homebase for a stadium
amd that menu item has been tagged as "Android only"
and we navigate to that stadium's Ballpark Guide
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will see the menu item on Android devices
and will NOT see the menu item on iOS devices

*in homebase tag mobile platform: Android

custom_steps_separated.content:
When we set up a Menu Item in QA Homebase for a stadium
and that menu item has been tagged as "iOS only"
and we navigate to that stadium's Ballpark Guide
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the menu item will NOT be displayed on Android devices
and will be displayed on iOS devices

*in homebase tag mobile platform: iOS

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the Ballpark Guide page
and scrolls down
and team has Insider content
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a section labelled 'TeamName Insider'
and it will be below the Video section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the Ballpark Guide page
and the team has Insider content
and the user scrolls down to the Insider section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the menu items in the section will be tappable
and the pages will open in a webview

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is in the Ballpark Guide of a team
and has not checked into a game for that team's stadium
and the user scrolls down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The user will see a Game Highlights section
and the Game Highlights section will be below the Services & Information section and above the Videos section
and the Game Highlights section will say 'Check-In is required to view highlights'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the Ballpark Guide page of a team's stadium
and has checked into a live game (use Beta.Master)
and scrolls down
and goes to the Game Highlights section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then there will be a thumbnail for the video(s)(In cases in which no thumbnail is available, an MLB.com placeholder icon should appear
and the video's title will appear across the bottom
and the date will appear below the title(there will be a space between the two)
and the video's duration time will appear next to the date in a HH:MM:SS format
and there will be a white dot in between the video's duration time and date

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on a team's Ballpark Guide page
and the user has checked into the game(use Beta.Master)
and the user has scrolled down to the Game Highlights section
and clicks on See All located next to the Game Highlights title
custom_steps_separated.expected: The Highlights video page will come in from right to left

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has checked into a game(use Prod.location)
and navigates to the Highlights page
and scrolls up and down the page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The user will be able to so successfully
and scrolling will be smooth

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has checked into a game(use Prod.location)
and navigates to the Highlights page
and anywhere in the cell for any video is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight video will begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the photo button located in the section below the BP image
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a message will appear asking to take photo or upload photo

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps on the photo button located in the section below the BP image
AND either chooses to take or upload an image
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be taken through the photo upload/edit flow
*Photo upload/edit flow is in a separate suite: Photo Upload/Edit

custom_steps_separated.content: When user completes the photo upload/edit flow after uploading via the photo button on the bp guide page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the uploaded photo will appear in the user's Journal photos page
AND the photo will display the ballpark name and date

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the Ballpark tab is renamed via Homebase e.g. from 
{
title: "Ballpark",
position: "0",
type: "ballpark",
...
},

to

{
title: "Petco Park",
position: "0",
type: "ballpark",
...
},
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the configured name will display for the Ballpark tab title in the app

title: Custom App Icon

custom_steps_separated.content: When user is on a device with iOS lower than 10.3 and scrolls to the bottom of the Ballpark Guide
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be no Set Home Screen icon option

custom_steps_separated.content: When user is on a device with iOS 10.3 or greater and scrolls to the bottom of the Ballpark Guide of a white listed team (check appconfig.json)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a Set Home Screen icon option

custom_steps_separated.content: When user is on a device with iOS 10.3 or greater and scrolls to the bottom of the Ballpark Guide of a team not on the white list (check appconfig.json)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be no Set Home Screen icon option

custom_steps_separated.content: When user meets above conditions (iOS version, white list and scrolls to bottom of BPG) and taps on the option
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to set set home screen icon controls with a description, reset link and preview of the selected ballpark's home screen icon

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on the home screen icon option
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a message will appear the user's icon has been changed with the icon in the message window

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user backgrounds Ballpark and checks on the home screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the icon they recently set in Ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user searches their device for Ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the customized icon

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user goes to device settings and locates Ballpark (e.g. security and permissions)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the customized icon

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user receives a notification for Ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the default Ballpark icon for the notification

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has their icon customized goes to another team Ballpark Guide page (that is not white listed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be no Set Home Screen icon option

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has their icon customized and goes views that same team's Ballpark Guide page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see their customized icon in the Set Home Screen icon option

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has their icon customized and goes to another team Ballpark Guide page (that is white listed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not see the customized icon for the Set Home Screen button, they will see that team's customized icon

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has their icon customized and taps on any Set Home Screen button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to set set home screen icon controls with a description, reset link and preview of the selected ballpark's home screen icon. They will see their current icon set in a preview in the top left regardless of what team Ballpark Guide entry point. 
(e.g. if user sets icon to Mets, goes to Yankees BPG and enters the set icon view they will see their icon set as Mets even though Yankee Stadium was the entry point)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user changes their customized icon to another custom icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the new icon used in all of the above scenarios (home screen, search, settings, but NOT notifications)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user resets their customized icon back to the default Ballpark icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the default icon used in all of the above scenarios (home screen, search, settings, notifications)

title: Videos

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to the Videos page
and looking at the contents of a video cell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then there will be a thumbnail for the video (in cases in which no thumbnail is available, an MLB.com placeholder icon should appear)
and the video's title will appear across the bottom
and the date will appear below the title(there will be space in between the two)
and the video's duration time will appear next to the date in a HH:MM:SS format
and there will be a white dot in between the video's duration time and date

custom_steps_separated.content: When the See All button is tapped in Videos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Videos page will open

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to the Videos page
and the Videos page opens successfully
and the user scrolls down the list quickly
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then an MLB.com logo will appear as a placeholder for any/all video thumbnails before they fully load
or for any videos with no thumbnails

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to the Videos page
and attempting to scroll up or down on the page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The user will be able to so successfully
and scrolling will be smooth

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to the Videos page
and anywhere in the cell for any video is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has begun video playback 
and the user single taps on the screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: The the controller UI will appear/disappear depending on the state prior to being tapped

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a video is currently playing
and the user has tapped on the screen to bring up the controller UI
and the Play/Pause icon is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: The the video will stop/start depending on the state video is in prior to the tap

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a video is playing
and the controller UI is on screen
and the volume slider is moved either left or right
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the volume will either be raised (right) or lowered (left) depending on slider position

custom_steps_separated.content:
When video playback is in progress
and the FF/RW scrubber's position is moved left or right
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will either be fast-forwarded (left) or rewound (right)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a video is playing
and the UI controller is on-screen
and the Done button is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken back to the Videos page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the device has a carrier connection (WiFi Off)
and the user is in the Videos page
and video playback is started
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will play without issue

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the device has a WiFi connection
and the user is in the Videos page
and video playback is started
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will play without issue

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to the Videos page
and reviewing the video titles for each video
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the title will be correctly associated with the video played

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to the Videos page
and the Ballpark (back) button is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken back to the Ballpark Guide page for the related team's ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a video playback has been started
and the app is backgrounded during playback
and the app is foregrounded
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought back to the video player with the video paused

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a video playback has been started
and the device is locked during playback
and the device is unlocked
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought back to the video player with the video to autoplay
(At Bat behaves the same way).

title: Maps & POI
custom_preconds:
Check the ballpark config for POI enabled teams, they will appear under "poiWhitelist" section
Config example: http://ballparkappconfig.mlb.com/ios/6.1.0/appconfig.json 

Use the following wiki for additional details on how to test POI:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?title=iBeacon+Testing&spaceKey=QAspace

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the POI Indicator on the top right of Ballpark Guide
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the POI list view
and the nearby POI will be listed at the top

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the page of POI detail page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see an 'Add Photo' button on the top right

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on a the page of a POI
AND the user taps on the 'Add Photo' button located on the top right
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be prompted to take photo or choose photo from their gallery

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has tapped on the Ballpark Map & Directory button
and the user has tapped the 'Select Category' button
and the user is in the category type overlay
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user can only select one type at a time
and once the user selects a type the overlay will slide down
and the user will be returned to the map view
and the selected type will be displayed
and all venues in selected type will be populated in the map view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is in the Select Category overlay
and there is a Category that does not have any amenities associated to it
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then that category will not be displayed in the Select Category overlay

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has taps on the Ballpark Map & Directory button
and taps on one (or many) of the item buttons
and can confirm that a description of the item will pop up
and taps on one of the descriptions of an item
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to that respective items detail page

Repeat for each item button; Restroom, Food, Beverage, ATM, Info, Shopping, Tickets, Specialty

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has tapped on the Ballpark Map & Directory button
and the Levels dropdown is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the menu will slide down
and the user will be able to select a level
and selecting a level will cause the menu to slide up
and the user will be on the selected level
and the name of that level will be in the top bar
and all levels will be visible in the dropdown at once

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has tapped on the Ballpark Map & Directory button
and the Search Button is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then there will be an alphabetical sort button and a category sort button in the header
and below the buttons will be a search bar
and a list of all of the venues concession stands and amenities will appear
and there will be an alphabetical scroller on the right side of the screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has tapped on the Ballpark Map & Directory button
and the user clicks on the Search button
and user sorts by 'Type'(2nd segment controller button)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then all entries will be sorted by category 

(Restroom, Food, Beverage, ATM, Info, Shopping, Tickets, Specialty)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to the Ballpark Map & Directory button
and has tapped on the Search button
and the user selects an option in the list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a page will open with the items location
and will list any additional locations in the stadium

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the back button on the search view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be taken back to the map view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user gets to amenity detail page from map
and taps Back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then take user to map view where user entered from

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is in Maps
and the user has the filter set to Ballpark Attractions
and the user taps on a POI venue icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a bubble
and the bubble will show the category icon, venue name, and nearby indicator

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is in Maps
and there are POIs on the map
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the POI icons will follow this key:

Blue POI Pin = Near POI
Grey POI Pin = Far POI

(this will be tested in greater depth in the Beacons test case section)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the POI list view or map view 
and user is in defined range and taps the POI
and the Detail View loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the POI name 
and a sponsorship blurb/subhead 
and media (either image or video) tap to play video or view image in full screen
and an offer link
and the level/location/section information 
and a long description 
and if the POI is restaurant there will be a tappable menu link

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is NOT nearby a POI
and the user taps the POI item
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will taken to the POI Detail Page

title: Native Schedule
custom_preconds:
Test plan:
1. Schedule a back to back doubleheader at any ballpark
2. Schedule a day/night doubleheader at any ballpark
3. Confirm that promotion with and without an image exists
4. Confirm that a check-in offer exists for a game at any ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user goes to the ballpark guide of a team
and the user taps on the Schedule button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the native schedule for that team
and the schedule will default to the current day

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on a team's native schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see three tabs: Home, Full, and Calendar

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user is on the Home tab of a native schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see all the home games for that team at that ballpark
and the user will see a Tickets button next to the game

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user is on the Full tab of a native schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN The user will see all the games for that team(home and away)
and only the Home games will have the tickets button in the game cell

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is looking at the contents of a team's native schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see the title Buy Tickets at the top
The month and year will be the title of each section
The date of the month and day will be on the left side of the game cell
The game cell will have vs Away team logo and team nickname
and below the team name will be the time of the game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a game that is in a preview state
and there are probable pitchers for that game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the probable pitches will display below the game time
and the home pitches will be first
and next to the home pitcher will be the away pitcher

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN you will see LIVE display below the team name

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in final status
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN you will see W or L followed by the score of the game
and below that will be the winning and losing pitchers

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is one or more promotions available for a game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN you will see the number of promotions available for that game
AND there will be an asterisk symbol to the left of the 'promotion' text

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a game has tickets available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see a tickets button on the right side of the game cell
and tapping on that tickets button will take you through the NTP flow or to the mobile tickets site if NTP is not enabled for that team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps on a game cell from native schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be brought to the event details of that game

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is viewing the event details
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the matchup displaying at the top including team logos
and below that will be the probable pitchers for the game with away pitcher first followed by the home pitcher
and below the probables will be the Promotions section(if available)
and below the promotions section will be the Check-In Offers section(if available)

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user views the event detail page a game that is in final status from the native schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see the winning(W) and Losing(L) pitches listed under the matchup cell

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the native schedule event details page
and there are tickets on sale for that game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN there will be a Buy Tickets button at the bottom of the page
and tapping on the Buy Tickets button will take you through the native ticket purchase flow

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the native schedule event details page of a game
and there is a promotion(s) or offer(s) for that game
and there are images for the promotion or offer
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see the promotion image display on the left side of the promotion description

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is a back to back doubleheader at a ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the game with a time will appear first 
and the the game without a time will display after the first game
and it will show Game 2 for the second game

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is a day/night doubleheader at a ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN game 1 will be listed first
and game 2 will display after the first game
and both games will display the time

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user goes to the calendar view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be able to scroll down through all the months

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the calendar view
and the user taps on a date cell
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be taken to the event details page of that game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a game where time is TBD
and the user opens the event details for that game
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the event details page will display TBD under the matchup in place of the time

title: Upcoming Events
custom_preconds:
User is on Ballpark Guide page looking at the section below the stadium image and action buttons
For all cases where the user is confirming upcoming event data - that Ballpark must have "eventsAvailable" set to true in the ballpark.json

example endpoint:
http://qa.ticketing-client.com/ticketing-client/json/EventTicketPromotion.tiksrv?team_id=108&team_xref_id=108&begin_date=20170511&end_date=20180510&display_in=ATBAT&site_section=Default&ticket_category=Tickets&offer_group=BALLPARKTAB&leave_empty_games=true&game_status=S&game_status=P&game_status=I&game_status=M&game_status=N&game_status=T&game_status=U&events=5

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the area below the stadium image and events are enabled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the upcoming events module with 5 dots below it, the first dot colored in to indicate the cell is displaying event info on the first of the next 5 available events

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at a cell on the upcoming events module and the event is a game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see team nicknames (away name @ home name), event date, event time, venue name. On opposing sides of the cell will be circle logos for the teams

Check for all team names and logos

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the event times on the upcoming events module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the times will reflect timezone local to the stadium regardless of the device preference or device timezone 

(Check ballparks in ET, CT, MT, PT and with device timezone set to international timezones)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user swipes on the upcoming event module
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the cell will display information for the next event chronologically scheduled at the ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on an event cell in the upcoming events module
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought the event details page. User will see the same matchup information at the top, buy tickets link, upgrades (if applicable), follow in At Bat, Photos, Event highlights

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at a non game event in the upcoming events module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the NGE title
Underneath the title - event date, event time, venue name
On the right side will be an image if available

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the upcoming events module and there fewer than five events available
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will only see that many dots underneath the cells and will only be able to swipe that many times

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the space below the stadium image and there are no events available or events are disabled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the entire module will not be visible and the first BPG section will be displayed under the stadium image (usually {Stadium Name} with the grid images)

title: AR capture mode is available in camera
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the Camera Options
custom_expected: THEN the ‘AR’ option will be available

title: AR experience is triggered by recognizing elements on the TV screen
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera AR capture mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user scans a recognizable element on the TV
custom_expected: THEN the interactive experience is triggered in Augmented Reality

title: AR experience is triggered by recognizing physical objects
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera AR capture mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user scans a recognizable physical Object
custom_expected: THEN the interactive augmented reality experience is triggered

title: AR experience can be triggered by scanning physical baseball
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera AR capture mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user scans a physical baseball
custom_expected: THEN the interactive augmented reality experience is triggered

title: AR experience can be triggered by scanning physical stadium signage
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera AR capture mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user scans a physical stadium signage
custom_expected: THEN the interactive augmented reality experience is triggered

title: AR experience can be triggered by scanning physical plaques
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the camera AR capture mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user scans a physical plaque
custom_expected: THEN the interactive augmented reality experience is triggered

title: 3D AR- As a user I want to see an interactive 3D model in the AR space when pointing at the trigger image
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has the AR camera enabled
custom_steps: AND the user is in 3D AR mode
custom_expected:
WHEN the user points the AR camera toward an image 
THEN the interactive 3D model displays

title: Video in AR-  Play a video in the AR space overlaid on the camera
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user points to play a video
custom_expected: THEN the video players on top of the AR camera in the AR space

title: Link to Webview available in AR
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera interface
AND the user is viewing a content in AR
AND that content has a webview button
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps this button
custom_expected:
THEN the webview launches
AND content associated with given content becomes available to the user

title: Video full screen button is available in AR
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR interface
AND the user is viewing a video which overlaps the AR interface camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the video controls
custom_expected: THEN a full screen button will be available

title: User is transitioned to Video full screen is available in AR
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR interface
AND the user is viewing a video which overlaps the AR interface camera
AND the user views the video controls
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps the full screen video button
custom_expected: THEN the video will transition to full screen

title: User is transitioned back to normal Video screen in AR
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR interface
AND the user is viewing a video which overlaps the AR interface camera
AND the user is viewing this video in full screen
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps the shrink video screen video button
custom_expected: THEN the video will transition back to normal size overlapping the AR camera

title: Native ticket purchase flow option available in AR interface
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in the AR camera interface
custom_steps: WHEN the users is viewing the available buttons
custom_expected: THEN there will be a ‘Native ticket Purchase’ flow button available

title: Tapping native ticket purchase flow transitions user to native ticket purchase flow
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in the AR camera interface
custom_steps:
WHEN the users is viewing the available buttons
AND the user taps the ‘Native ticket Purchase’ flow button
custom_expected: THEN the user will be transitioned to the native ticket purchase flow

title: Record scanned tags
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has previously unlocked interactive elements by scanning AR tags
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in the AR interface
custom_expected: THEN the user can access the recorded scanned tags which are saved

title: Record Scan in Ballpark Inbox
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has unlocked an offer
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to their ballpark inbox
custom_expected: THEN there will be a message available indicating that an offer has been unlocked

title: Record Scan in Email
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is scanning an item
custom_steps: WHEN the user unlocks an offer during scanning
custom_expected: THEN a message is sent to the users inbox indicating that an offer has been unlocked

title: AR Camera launches when tapping AR/ Augmented Reality from Ballpark page
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on a ballpark team page for a team which supports AR
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the grid elements
custom_expected: THEN ‘AR’ or ‘Augmented Reality’ will be available for the given team

title: ‘x’ button is available while in AR Camera
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user taps AR for a team
custom_steps: WHEN the user is navigated to the AR camera
custom_expected: THEN the ‘x’ button will be available

title: Tapping ‘x’ closes out the AR camera
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user taps AR for a team
AND the user is navigated to the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps the ‘x’ button on the top corner
custom_expected:
THEN the AR camera will close
AND the user will be navigated to the previous screen (point of AR entry)

title: ‘Center image in the frame’ instruction displays before AR is scanned
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the camera
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the instruction on the screen to ‘center image in the frame'

title: ‘Center image in the frame’ instruction does not display after AR scan begins
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_expected: THEN the ‘Center image in the frame’ instruction will not display

title: 4 points display in the camera to guide user to center image within the boundary
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user launches the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the camera
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the instruction on the screen with a box which has 4 points and acts as the image center boundary

title: Spinner spins while AR scan is occuring
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_expected: THEN the spinner will spin indicating to the user that a scan is occuring

title: AR Video begins after AR image is scanned and recognized
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
AND the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_steps: WHEN the scan completes
custom_expected: THEN the AR video will begin on top of the image

title: Web view button associated with AR image/video becomes available when AR video begins
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
AND the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_steps: WHEN the scan completes
custom_expected: THEN a web view link will be available

title: Text associated with AR image/video becomes available when AR video begins
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
AND the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_steps: WHEN the scan completes
custom_expected: THEN the description related to the AR video will display

title: Tapping web view button navigates user to the web view  url associated with AR image/video
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has scanned a recognized object with the AR camera
custom_steps:
WHEN the scan is complete
AND the user tap the web view button
custom_expected: THEN the user will be navigated to the correct web view url

title: ‘Rescan’ button becomes available after user scans AR image and video begins or completes
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has scanned a recognized object with the AR camera
custom_steps: WHEN the scan is completes
custom_expected: THEN the ‘rescan’ button becomes available to the user

title: Tapping ‘Rescan’ begins rescan of target image
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has scanned a recognized object with the AR camera
AND the scan is complete
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps ‘rescan’
custom_expected: THEN the AR camera begins to rescan

title: ‘Dismiss’ button is available after user scans AR image and video begins or completes
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
AND the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_steps: WHEN the scan completes
custom_expected: THEN the ‘dismiss’ button becomes available for the description area

title: Tapping ‘dismiss’ dismisses metadata associated with the AR image/video
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in the AR camera
AND the user begins scanning a recognized image
custom_steps:
WHEN the scan completes 
AND the user taps the ‘dismiss’ button for the description area
custom_expected: THEN the corresponding metadata will be dismissed
